definition: to accept misfortunes as decreed by fate/to be resigned to sth
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: By the seventh day, Felix, accepting his fate, no longer begged for mercy.
sentences.chinese: 第七天，費利克斯認命了，不再祈求寬恕。

sentences.english: Resign to my fate, and face the world with a smile, and not make myself miserable.
sentences.chinese: 認命，也瀟灑地以微笑來面對，不要讓自己痛苦。

sentences.english: If he leaves, I can only accept reality and.
Mr. Meant-to has a friend, his name is Didn't-Do.
sentences.chinese: “認命”先生有一位朋友，他的名字叫“別幹”。

sentences.english: Please note that appointments of many of the positions are made between June and August.
sentences.chinese: 請注意很多職位的認命是六月到八月完成的。

sentences.english: In summer, people dress in casual clothes, like T-shirts and shorts.
sentences.chinese: 夏天，認命都穿休閒服裝，例如短褲。

sentences.english: I named all, change is the reality.
sentences.chinese: 我認命所有的一切，改變不了的就是現實。

sentences.english: Many people think that they have to accept whatever life throws at them.
sentences.chinese: 許多人認爲人應該認命接受生活拋給自己的一切。

definition: to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
to bear patiently/to endure silently/to forbear
to sever all relations with sb/determined/decisive
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
to endure humiliation as part of an important mission (idiom); to suffer in silence
